bibl.title: Headhunting on the Roman Frontier: (Dis)respect, Mockery, Magic and the Head of Augustus from Meroe.
bibl.note: Prelude to headhunting. - Scenario 1: The gift of Rome to the king of Meroe. - Scenario 2: Headhunting across the First cataract. - Scenario 3: Headhunting in Qasr Ibrim. - Agencies and (dis)respect. - Magic and mockery. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: The Edges of the Roman World.

bibl.seg: Uroš Matić, Headhunting on the Roman Frontier: (Dis)respect, Mockery, Magic and the Head of Augustus from Meroe.
Marko A. Janković, Vladimir D. Mihajlović & Staša Babić (edd.), The Edges of the Roman World (Cambridge, 2014) pp. 117-134.

Prelude to headhunting. - Scenario 1: The gift of Rome to the king of Meroe. - Scenario 2: Headhunting across the First cataract. - Scenario 3: Headhunting in Qasr Ibrim. - Agencies and (dis)respect. - Magic and mockery. - Conclusion.
